Title: A Note on Fractional Curl Operator
Abstract: in this letter we demonstrate that the fractional curl operator widely used in electromagnetics since 1998 is essentially a rotation operation of components of the complex riemann‚äìsilberstein vector representing the electromagnetic field. it occurs that after the wave decomposition into circular polarisations the standard duality rotation with the angle depending on the fractional order is applied to the left handed basis vector while the right handed basis vector stems from the complex conjugation of the left handed counterpart. therefore the fractional curl operator describes another representation of rotations of the electromagnetic field decomposed into circular polarisations. finally we demonstrate that this operator can describe a single qubit phase shift gate in quantum computing.
